reviews.text: This cozy coffee shop is a hidden gem,  and the friendly staff make you feel right at home. Their menu offers a delightful selection of rich, flavorful coffees, alongside freshly baked pastries that pair perfectly. The soft lighting create a relaxing vibe, ideal for catching up with friends or getting lost in a good book. Whether you‚Äôre a coffee connoisseur or just looking for a quiet spot to unwind, this place won‚Äôt disappoint.

Love the Matcha Latte and Leaf Pie, they go so well together! The Matcha Latte is not too sweet with medium matcha intensity, and sweetened slightly with their delicious whipped foam. The Daily Coffee is pretty good too, with their special blend. Would recommend for anyone in the area looking for a short coffee break. I‚Äôd love to try the Matcha Affogato next!!

Oh, by the way I love the sando ü•∞‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è Sooo good ü§åü§åü§å must try!

Wanted some specialty coffee after lunch at CentrePoint and was delighted to have discovered this cosy little spot run by a group of friendly Japanese folks.

They have a select range of pour-over coffee to choose from - from single origin light roast to the classic dark Japanese blends. I had an iced Kilimanjaro single origin light roast, which they brewed for me using a Simplify dripper.

This is also a great spot to shop for coffee equipment - drippers, kettles, coffee cups and bottles from brands like Kono, Origami, Hario, Timemore.

Will return for more the next time I‚Äôm in Singapore!
The matcha affogato with vanilla ice-cream is super good here, the matcha is super smooth here. Would definitely recommend coming here, will be back here soon.
the usual pour over coffee tends to taste diluted and bland. but this one is really good n aromatic! will be back to try other beans. üòÅ
